headline: Fed Signals More Cuts, But Powell Says Don't Be Too Sure (Live Coverage)
summary: The Federal Reserve delivered its first interest-rate cut of the year on Wednesday and bolstered hopes for further rate cuts in October and December.  After the 2 p.m. ET policy statement, the S&P 500 traded fractionally higher in afternoon stock market action as Fed chief Jerome Powell painted a cautiously upbeat picture of where the economy stands.  What Wall Street really wanted to know was whether the Fed saw this as the first cut of a bunch or whether we could quickly be back in wait-and-see mode.

After the 2 p.m. ET policy statement, the S&P 500 traded fractionally higher in afternoon stock market action as Fed chief Jerome Powell painted a cautiously upbeat picture of where the economy stands.  What Wall Street really wanted to know was whether the Fed saw this as the first cut of a bunch or whether we could quickly be back in wait-and-see mode.

headline: Broadcom (AVGO) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of fabless chip and software maker Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) fell 3.3% in the morning session after a broader pullback sparked by reports that China banned its major tech firms from buying U.S. artificial intelligence chips. The negative sentiment weighed heavily on the Nasdaq, with the news first hitting chipmaker Nvidia and then rippling out to drag down fellow tech giants, including Broadcom.

raw.headline: Broadcom (AVGO) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
raw.summary: Shares of fabless chip and software maker Broadcom (NASDAQ:AVGO) fell 3.3% in the morning session after a broader pullback sparked by reports that China banned its major tech firms from buying U.S. artificial intelligence chips. The negative sentiment weighed heavily on the Nasdaq, with the news first hitting chipmaker Nvidia and then rippling out to drag down fellow tech giants, including Broadcom.

headline: China tells tech firms to stop buying Nvidia's AI chips, FT reports
summary: STORY: Shares of Nvidia slipped Wednesday morning following reports that China ordered its top tech firms to stop buying Nvidia's AI chips, escalating tensions in the U.S.-China trade war.The Financial Times reported on Wednesday that the Cyberspace Administration of China, or CAC, has directed companies like ByteDance and Alibaba to halt testing and cancel orders of Nvidia’s RTX Pro 6000D chip.The report comes just days after Beijing accused Nvidia of violating its anti-monopoly law, and after U.S. officials voiced national security concerns at trade talks with China.Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Wednesday responded by saying he was "disappointed" with what he saw and that the U.S. and Beijing have "larger agendas to work out," adding that the chipmaker "can only be in service of a market if a country wants us to be."Successive U.S. administrations have restricted China’s access to advanced semiconductors, prompting Beijing to push domestic firms away from American suppliers.Reuters earlier this week reported lukewarm demand for the RTX6000D chip, with some firms backing out even before the ban.Alibaba, ByteDance and the CAC did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment.

raw.headline: China tells tech firms to stop buying Nvidia's AI chips, FT reports
raw.summary: STORY: Shares of Nvidia slipped Wednesday morning following reports that China ordered its top tech firms to stop buying Nvidia's AI chips, escalating tensions in the U.S.-China trade war.The Financial Times reported on Wednesday that the Cyberspace Administration of China, or CAC, has directed companies like ByteDance and Alibaba to halt testing and cancel orders of Nvidia’s RTX Pro 6000D chip.The report comes just days after Beijing accused Nvidia of violating its anti-monopoly law, and after U.S. officials voiced national security concerns at trade talks with China.Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Wednesday responded by saying he was "disappointed" with what he saw and that the U.S. and Beijing have "larger agendas to work out," adding that the chipmaker "can only be in service of a market if a country wants us to be."Successive U.S. administrations have restricted China’s access to advanced semiconductors, prompting Beijing to push domestic firms away from American suppliers.Reuters earlier this week reported lukewarm demand for the RTX6000D chip, with some firms backing out even before the ban.Alibaba, ByteDance and the CAC did not immediately respond to Reuters requests for comment.

headline: Fed Meeting: Rate-Cut Coming, But Watch Out For These 2 Words (Live Coverage)
summary: The Federal Reserve is set to deliver its first interest-rate cut after a nine-month pause, and markets have little doubt that it will be a quarter-point move.  Any surprise is likely to come from the rate cut's packaging — from the number of dissenting votes, to future interest-rate projections to the outlook Fed Chairman Jerome Powell offers at his post-meeting news conference.  What Wall Street really wants to know is whether the Fed sees this as the first cut of a bunch or whether we could quickly be back in wait-and-see mode.

raw.headline: Fed Meeting: Rate-Cut Coming, But Watch Out For These 2 Words (Live Coverage)
raw.summary: The Federal Reserve is set to deliver its first interest-rate cut after a nine-month pause, and markets have little doubt that it will be a quarter-point move.  Any surprise is likely to come from the rate cut's packaging — from the number of dissenting votes, to future interest-rate projections to the outlook Fed Chairman Jerome Powell offers at his post-meeting news conference.  What Wall Street really wants to know is whether the Fed sees this as the first cut of a bunch or whether we could quickly be back in wait-and-see mode.

Through an agreement with the Department of Energy's Oak Ridge National Laboratory (ORNL), an NVIDIA DGX system has been installed at the EPB Quantum Center℠ in Chattanooga, Tennessee, which is already home to America's first commercially available quantum network and IonQ's Forte Enterprise Quantum Computer scheduled for commissioning in early 202

headline: Trump's UK visit: US Big Tech to invest billions in UK's AI
summary: President Trump is visiting the UK to meet with Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Thursday, accompanied by several Big Tech CEOs. This comes as names like Microsoft (MSFT), Google (GOOG, GOOGL), Nvidia (NVDA), Salesforce (CRM), OpenAI (OPAI.PVT), and GSK (GSK) pledged $42.3 billion worth of artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure investments in the UK as part of the "Tech Prosperity Deal." Yahoo Finance anchor Ramzan Karmali joins Morning Brief with Julie Hyman to discuss the details. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: AI Weekly: OpenAI makes a deal, Oracle makes waves
summary: STORY: From OpenAI getting one step closer to making money, to how Oracle made Wall Street take notice, this is AI Weekly.:: AI Weekly:: MicrosoftMicrosoft and OpenAI have struck a deal to restructure their relationship.Though the details aren’t set in stone, that should clear the way for the ChatGPT maker to become a for-profit firm.OpenAI wants more freedom to work with other firms besides Microsoft, which has been its main backer.:: MicrosoftBut the Windows maker wants to make sure it keeps access to the startup’s AI tech.Nvidia’s latest chips for the Chinese market seem to be getting a lukewarm response.Reuters sources say some major tech firms there have opted not to place orders.They say the new chip is seen as expensive for what it does.And they say performance lags older models that the U.S. has banned for sale in China, but which are readily available through grey market channels.:: OracleOracle has gone from AI laggard to potential champion.Shares in the firm surged after it gave a bullish outlook for sales related to the new tech, while the Wall Street Journal says it has a $300 billion deal just with OpenAI.GLOBALT Investments partner Keith Buchanan says the numbers made Wall Street take notice:"The sheer magnitude of just how quickly they've been able to get up the curve and also show it through commitments on the other side is what the big surprise was.” Donald Trump hit London for a state visit, with the two sides agreeing an AI-focused tech deal to mark the event.That will see top US firms invest billions in the country to help drive the new tech.Among other projects, Microsoft said it would spend around $30 billion to expand AI and cloud infrastructure in the UK, while also helping to build the country’s biggest AI supercomputer.And AI has wildlife experts puzzled.Researchers used the tech to estimate the number of wildebeest in Africa’s so-called Great Migration.:: Maxar Technologies / Tiejun WangThe bots looked at satellite images, and counted 600,000 of the animals, or less than half the number usually cited.:: Maxar Technologies / Tiejun WangNow the question is whether wildebeest numbers are really falling, or if one of the two estimates is way out.

raw.headline: AI Weekly: OpenAI makes a deal, Oracle makes waves
raw.summary: STORY: From OpenAI getting one step closer to making money, to how Oracle made Wall Street take notice, this is AI Weekly.:: AI Weekly:: MicrosoftMicrosoft and OpenAI have struck a deal to restructure their relationship.Though the details aren’t set in stone, that should clear the way for the ChatGPT maker to become a for-profit firm.OpenAI wants more freedom to work with other firms besides Microsoft, which has been its main backer.:: MicrosoftBut the Windows maker wants to make sure it keeps access to the startup’s AI tech.Nvidia’s latest chips for the Chinese market seem to be getting a lukewarm response.Reuters sources say some major tech firms there have opted not to place orders.They say the new chip is seen as expensive for what it does.And they say performance lags older models that the U.S. has banned for sale in China, but which are readily available through grey market channels.:: OracleOracle has gone from AI laggard to potential champion.Shares in the firm surged after it gave a bullish outlook for sales related to the new tech, while the Wall Street Journal says it has a $300 billion deal just with OpenAI.GLOBALT Investments partner Keith Buchanan says the numbers made Wall Street take notice:"The sheer magnitude of just how quickly they've been able to get up the curve and also show it through commitments on the other side is what the big surprise was.” Donald Trump hit London for a state visit, with the two sides agreeing an AI-focused tech deal to mark the event.That will see top US firms invest billions in the country to help drive the new tech.Among other projects, Microsoft said it would spend around $30 billion to expand AI and cloud infrastructure in the UK, while also helping to build the country’s biggest AI supercomputer.And AI has wildlife experts puzzled.Researchers used the tech to estimate the number of wildebeest in Africa’s so-called Great Migration.:: Maxar Technologies / Tiejun WangThe bots looked at satellite images, and counted 600,000 of the animals, or less than half the number usually cited.:: Maxar Technologies / Tiejun WangNow the question is whether wildebeest numbers are really falling, or if one of the two estimates is way out.

headline: Nvidia CEO disappointed over China chip ban report
summary: Nvidia chief executive Jensen Huang on Wednesday said he was disappointed by a report that Beijing has barred major Chinese tech companies from buying his company's world-leading chips, a crucial component in the generative AI revolution.Beijing has responded by expressing national security concerns about Nvidia chips and urging Chinese businesses to rely on local semiconductor suppliers instead.

headline: Quantinuum CEO Says It’s at a ‘Turning Point.’ The Company Is Achieving New Feats in Quantum Computing.
summary: Quantinuum, the quantum computing company majority-owned by  Honeywell International  has come a long way this year.  CEO Rajeeb Hazra delivered the keynote speech at Quantum World Congress 2025 on Wednesday, during which he highlighted Quantinuum’s progress since last year’s event.  “Every year we’ve kicked the can down the road, but this feels like a turning point,” Hazra tells Barron’s. “And we drove it with these advancements.”

Since the AI tool's launch, the stock has surged over 900%, rewarding investors who got in early. In July, an investor on Reddit shared how he got in early on Nvidia, turning an initial investment of $36,352 into more than $1 million in profits by patiently holding the stock for eight years. summary: General Mills (GIS) shares react after its earnings release, Workday (WDAY) flies high after activist investors' feedback on a multi-year growth plan, and Blockchain lender Figure (FIGR) soars ahead of the Fed's rate decision. headline: Fed decision, China's Nvidia ban, TikTok deal: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are largely flat as Wall Street awaits the Federal Reserve's latest interest rate decision coming out of its policy meeting later today. Experts anticipate Fed officials to cut rates by 25 basis points for the first time in 2025. China is banning companies from buying AI chips from major semiconductor manufacturer Nvidia (NVDA), according to Financial Times reports. Following fresh trade negotiations between the US and China, the latter has agreed to a deal framework for selling TikTok. Hear what Wire China editor Andrew Peaple has to say about US-China trade talks in regards to Nvidia, TikTok, and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Nvidia CEO Huang says he's disappointed by China chip curbs
summary: The CEO of Nvidia, which faces tight restrictions on selling its chips to China amid the U.S.-China battle over trade and tech, said he's disappointed about the situation.  Jensen Huang said he expects to discuss the latest developments with President Donald Trump at a state banquet hosted by the British government that they'll be attending on Wednesday night.  Santa Clara, California-based Nvidia, the world's most valuable company, is restricted from exporting , to China its most advanced chips, which are in demand for developing artificial intelligence.

headline: AI Chips Update - UK Boosts AI Power With Massive NVIDIA GPU Deployment
summary: Nscale, in collaboration with leading US technology companies Microsoft, NVIDIA, and OpenAI, has announced a significant commitment to developing AI infrastructure in the UK. This ambitious plan involves deploying up to 58,640 NVIDIA GPUs across various UK sites and is a part of a broader...

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Nvidia, Workday, Tesla, FedEx, General Mills, and More
summary: Stock futures were mixed Wednesday with Wall Street widely expecting the Federal Reserve to reduce a key interest rate by a quarter-point later in the trading session.  Nvidia  fell 1.3% after report from the Financial Times said China’s internet regulator had banned the country’s biggest tech companies from buying its artificial-intelligence chips.  The Cyberspace Administration of China told TikTok parent ByteDance and e-commerce giant  Alibaba  among others, to end testing and orders of Nvidia’s tailored-made products for China, the Financial Times reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

The Cyberspace Administration of China told TikTok parent ByteDance and e-commerce giant  Alibaba  among others, to end testing and orders of Nvidia’s tailored-made products for China, the Financial Times reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

headline: US stock futures subdued as caution prevails before Fed's rate-cut decision; Nvidia slips
summary: Wall Street futures were flat to slightly lower on Wednesday, as markets were guarded ahead of a widely anticipated interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve later in the day, and Nvidia dipped after a report Chinese tech firms might stop buying its chips.  The U.S. central bank is expected to reduce borrowing costs by at least 25 basis points at 2 p.m. ET, a move priced in by investors after a series of economic indicators indicated a weakening jobs market.  Markets will closely watch Chair Jerome Powell's speech as well as the "dot plot" projections to gauge the extent of interest-rate cuts that could be delivered this year and the next.

raw.headline: US stock futures subdued as caution prevails before Fed's rate-cut decision; Nvidia slips

Markets will closely watch Chair Jerome Powell's speech as well as the "dot plot" projections to gauge the extent of interest-rate cuts that could be delivered this year and the next.

headline: Oracle Sparks Bubble Talk With Stock Price in Dot-Com Territory
summary: Shares of the database software company have soared 84% this year, the seventh-best performance in the S&P 500 Index, as scorching demand for AI computing turbocharges its revenue growth.  Oracle also has been linked to the Trump administration’s negotiations to keep TikTok operating in the US.  The company has served as TikTok’s primary cloud infrastructure provider for years.

headline: Alibaba AI Chip Effort Quickens With Big Client China Unicom
summary: China’s e-commerce leader has signed a contract with the country’s No. 2 wireless carrier to deploy its Pingtouge or “T-Head” AI accelerators, according to a video posted late Tuesday by state broadcaster CCTV.  The chips will go into the mobile operator’s big new data center in northwestern China, alongside accelerators provided by rivals MetaX and Biren Technology Co. Alibaba’s shares gained 5.3% Wednesday to their highest level since 2021, joining a broad Chinese tech stock rally as investors piled into major AI-related names.  It’s unclear to what extent Unicom is deploying Alibaba chips.

raw.headline: Alibaba AI Chip Effort Quickens With Big Client China Unicom
raw.summary: China’s e-commerce leader has signed a contract with the country’s No. 2 wireless carrier to deploy its Pingtouge or “T-Head” AI accelerators, according to a video posted late Tuesday by state broadcaster CCTV.  The chips will go into the mobile operator’s big new data center in northwestern China, alongside accelerators provided by rivals MetaX and Biren Technology Co. Alibaba’s shares gained 5.3% Wednesday to their highest level since 2021, joining a broad Chinese tech stock rally as investors piled into major AI-related names.  It’s unclear to what extent Unicom is deploying Alibaba chips.
